meanings.definition: To move or transfer (troops or equipment) to a new position.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were redeploying to the northern border for a new mission.
meanings.sent2: The company is redeploying its machinery to the factory across town.
meanings.sent3: The tanks were redeploying in a dance-like formation, much to the amusement of the spectators.
meanings.sent4: The chess pieces on the board were redeploying strategically, like a well-thought-out battle plan.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ants redeploying their food across the leaf was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To assign or allocate (resources or personnel) in a different way.
meanings.sent1: The manager was redeploying staff to cover the busy evening shifts.
meanings.sent2: The government is redeploying funds to support the new healthcare initiative.
meanings.sent3: The office supplies were redeploying themselves mysteriously, causing confusion among the employees.
meanings.sent4: The words in the document were redeploying to form a new, unexpected meaning.
meanings.sent5: The colors on the artist's palette were constantly redeploying, creating a dynamic painting.
